page.title: 16CANALSIDE ECOLOGY, THATCHAM.
page.content: On the banks of the Kennet and Avon Canal where it passes through the area we looked at flowers and saw Yellow Flag Iris, Daisy, Ivy, Water Lily and Yellow Water Lily. For one of our specimens we picked a Foxglove which is poisonous. As we came down to the canal, we saw two swans, a cob and pen. In the water we saw minnows and a Water Skater. We also saw a snail and a dragonfly, some ants and caterpillars. We saw some Hawthorn, Ash, Pussy Willow and Alder trees. When we were looking for birds we saw geese, swans, ducks and a moor hen.
